snippet: Mr. Trump, whose appeal is predicated on an aura of toughness and perpetual success, seldom speaks of his brother Freddy, who died as an alcoholic in 1981 at age 43.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump, whose appeal is predicated on an aura of toughness and perpetual success, seldom speaks of his brother Freddy, who died as an alcoholic in 1981 at age 43.
abstract: Donald J Trump says watching his older brother Freddy sink into alcoholism and eventually die at age 43 taught him heavy toll of bad choices; admission offers rare moment of vulnerability for personality-driven presidential candidate; death of Freddy, airline pilot who did not apply himself to family real estate business, also serves as example of dangers of failing to conform to standards of aggressively driven clan.

headline.print_headline: For Trump, Lessons in a Brother’s Pain
headline.main: For Donald Trump, Lessons From a Brother’s Suffering
